intro: Derris pseudinvoluta, commonly known as the African snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or bean family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant is notable for containing rotenone, a natural pesticidal compound used in traditional agriculture. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Its ecological role includes nitrogen fixation, which enriches the soil and supports other plant life.
